channel.title: I have a question about a Virus
channel.description: I have a virus named adobe gamma loader.exe. Has anyone else had this trojan? I have downloaded anti-virus, firewall, ad-aware stuff so I'm set for that. I'm jw if it's easy to get rid of and what it's function is...? Thanks.. Daycrawler

item.title: I have a question about a Virus
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

As posted on neuber.com,

The Adobe Gamma Control Panel is used to eliminate color casts in a monitor’s display. This allows for accurate on-screen previews of an image as it will appear on a variety of other devices.

Read full topic
item.source: I have a question about a Virus

item.title: I have a question about a Virus
item.dc:creator: @yna_ajhear5 yna_ajhear5
item.description:
@yna_ajhear5 wrote:

It’s not a virus, and if it is, I had it before. I believe it is assosiated(sp) with Adobe Acrobat Reader.

Read full topic
item.source: I have a question about a Virus

item.title: I have a question about a Virus
item.dc:creator: @daycrawler daycrawler
item.description:
@daycrawler wrote:

I don’t have adobe photoshop though…

Read full topic
item.source: I have a question about a Virus

item.title: I have a question about a Virus
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

Um, I think it’s just something that starts up with photoshop or some other Adobe program. I would only be concerned if you don’t have any Adobe software. You can probably disable it from running on startup in “Administrative Tools”.

Read full topic
item.source: I have a question about a Virus
